page.title: 11MODEL SOLDIERS-HOUGHTON HALL
page.content: The collection made by Lord Cholmondeley was commenced in 1928.It is one of the largest and most comprehensive in the world, including battle scenes from 1746-1942.It includes figures made of lead and tin as well as a number of porcelain figures.The manufacturers include Stadden,Greenwood and Ball and Willie.The majority are 3D but there are also some dioramas of french flat soldiers and a few semi-flats.Many of the figures were specially commissioned by Lord Cholmondeley.All the figures are accurate in uniform, weapon and formation details. The soldiers are displayed in lay-outs of up to 3,OOO figures depicting historic battles and parades from around the world.The collection also houses militaria and paintings.
